title: Waterfall’s ‘Handmade’ calls for work
text:
Waterfall’s ‘Handmade’ calls for work Oct 09, 2015 Once again, waterfall Arts in Belfast will mount its popular “Handmade” show in December. 
Belfast — Waterfall Arts has put out the call for work for the annual “Handmade” show. Sought are makers of unique, quirky, upcycled artwork and handmade gifts with an unconventional, but professional aesthetic for this very popular show and sale. 
This year’s “Handmade” will run from Dec. 4 through 23. During this time, the gallery will be open Thursdays and Fridays from noon to 6 p.m.; and Saturdays and Sundays from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. The gallery will be beautifully decorated, and there will be a festive opening event for all ages Friday, Dec. 4, from 5 to 8 p.m. with local food, beverages and music. 
All work will be priced under $100; the financial arrangement is a 40/60 split, with 60 percent going to the artist. Examples of desired work are small works, hats, ceramics, T-shirts, greeting cards, jewelry, prints, photos, sculptures, furniture, soap products and more. 
To apply for inclusion in the show, artists can submit images via email to karin@waterfallarts.org; makers who do not have electronic images can make different arrangements by calling the office. Submissions will be accepted up to Friday, Oct. 30, and will be reviewed by an experienced committee. Upon selection, quantity and display details will be discussed individually. 
Since 2000, Waterfall Arts has served as the area’s nonprofit community art center, offering innovative classes, exhibitions, studio rentals, artist residencies and cultural events. For more information, visit http://waterfallarts.org/ #mce_temp_url# ; stop by 256 High St.; or call 338-2222.
